alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 6:18PM CDT until August 06 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Hancock, Hawkins and Sullivan. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Lee and Scott. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area in the next hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kingsport, Rogersville, Gate City, Sneedville, Surgoinsville, Weber City, Church Hill, Mount Carmel, Dungannon, Duffield, Clinchport, Okolona, Pattonsville, Kyles Ford, Jasper, Kepler, Dryden, Jearoldstown, Bays Mountain Park and McCloud. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
